title: Data Structure
description: Basic Data Structure with Java, Algorithm
detail: Learn the basics of Python programming
content:
## Workshop Content
This *workshop* covers basic data structures such as arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues.
### Topics Covered:
- **Arrays**: A collection of elements stored at contiguous memory locations.
- **Linked Lists**: A sequence of data structures, which are connected together via links.
- **Stacks**: A linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In First Out) principle.
- **Queues**: A linear data structure that follows the FIFO (First In First Out) principle.
#### Code Example:
```javascript
// Example of a simple array
const arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];
// Example of a stack implementation
const stack = [];
stack.push(1); // Add to stack
stack.pop();  // Remove from stack
```
> Note: This workshop assumes basic knowledge of programming concepts.
### Additional Resources:
- [GeeksforGeeks - Data Structures](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/data-structures/)
- [JavaScript Data Structures](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Data_structures)
---
Feel free to ask questions during the workshop!
